q:
What is the output of the following C code:

       #include<stdio.h>
        #include<string.h>
        int main()
        {
            static int num[3]={[0]=5,[2]=7};
            printf("%d",num[1]);
        }

What is the output of the following C code:


    int main()
    {
         static int a=20;
        printf("%d\n %d\n", a++,++a);

    }
In C, which of the following statements about external linkage is true?

a.option: It denotes static variables and functions with file scope.
It denotes global variables and functions, and non-static variables.

q:
What is the output of the following C code:

    #include<stdio.h>
    int main()
    {
        static int a[10];
        int j = 0;
        a[j] = j ;
        printf("%d, %d, %d\n", a[0], a[1], j);
    }

What is the output of the following C code:

    #include<stdio.h>
    void main()
    {
        static int n=3;
        printf("%d ",--n);
        if(n)
        main();
    }

What is the output of the following C++ code:

#include<iostream> 
using namespace std; 

class Test 
{ 
    private: 
    int x; 
    public: 
    void setX (int x) 
    { 
        this->x = x; 
    } 
    void print() 
    { 
        cout <<x << endl; 
    } 
}; 

int main() 
{ 
    Test obj; 
    int x = 20; 
    obj.setX(x); 
    obj.print(); 
    return 0; 
}

Â

a.option: Compiles successfully but nothing is printed

q:
What is the output of the following C code snippet:

#include <iostream>
#include <string.h>
using namespace std;
int main()
{
     static char a[]="hacker";
     printf("%d",strlen(a));
     printf("%c",*(a+strlen(a)-1));
}
